title: 9 Simple Ways to Tell If Someone Is Currently Online

steps.title: Instagram shows when users are currently active in chat.
steps.content: Instagram shows when users are currently active in chat. If you send a DM to someone, you can check the chat log for the user's activity status. If they're active, you'll see a green dot next to their name and Active now . If they aren't currently online, you'll see Active (yesterday, 4h ago, etc.) . Users can hide their activity status in their privacy settings. If this is disabled, you won't be able to see an Instagram user's online status. [1] X Research source

steps.title: On WhatsApp, you'll see "online" under their name.
steps.content: On WhatsApp, you'll see "online" under their name. Navigate to a WhatsApp conversation. At the top, you can see a person's activity status as long as it's enabled. If they are currently online on WhatsApp , you'll see online . Otherwise, you'll see when they were "last seen". [2] X Research source WhatsApp users can hide their activity status in their privacy settings. You may also be unable to see this information if a user has blocked you .

steps.title: On Facebook, a green dot means someone is active.
steps.content: On Facebook , a green dot means someone is active. Tap the Messenger icon in the top-right corner. This will open a list of all your friends currently active on Facebook or Messenger. [3] X Research source To know who's online on Facebook Messenger app, tap the People tab and look for a green dot next to their name. This means they are currently active or were recently active. [4] X Research source Keep in mind that users can hide their activity status in their privacy settings.

steps.title: On Snapchat, look for the green dot next to a friend's avatar.
steps.content: On Snapchat, look for the green dot next to a friend's avatar. This means they've been online on Snapchat recently. You can also see if someone is currently active in a chat if their Bitmoji or avatar can be seen peeking over the keyboard. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Discord users can be online with green, yellow, or red statuses.
steps.content: Discord users can be online with green, yellow, or red statuses. These colors represent different activity statuses. Green means Online , yellow means Idle , and red means Do Not Disturb . These statuses can be updated manually by the user. Discord users can also appear invisible . This means they can be active on Discord, but their activity status makes it look like they're offline.

steps.title: In Skype, users are online if their presence status is green.
steps.content: In Skype, users are online if their presence status is green. The green circle means the user is currently online and active. The yellow icon with the clock means the user has been inactive for one or more hours. The red icon means the user has set their status to Do not disturb . Skype users can also appear Invisible and hide their presence status. [6] X Research source

steps.title: On Xbox consoles, you can see the activity of your added friends.
steps.content: On Xbox consoles, you can see the activity of your added friends. Press the Xbox button to open the guide and select People . You'll see all your online friends and what games they're currently playing. [7] X Research source Players can appear offline . This means their status will not change from offline, regardless of their activity.

steps.title: You can view someone's PSN online status in your friend list.
steps.content: You can view someone's PSN online status in your friend list. Press the PlayStation button and select Friends . Users can set their status as Online or Busy . You'll also be able to see which games they're currently playing. Users can also set their online status to Invisible . This will hide their online status.

steps.title: On the Switch, you can see active users in your friend list.
steps.content: On the Switch, you can see active users in your friend list. When added friends are online, you'll see a notification in the bottom-right corner of the screen. This also pops up when a friend starts a game. However, this feature can be limited to "Best Friends" or disabled entirely.
